titleStmt.title: Here begynneth a treatyse agaynst pestele[n]ce [and] of ye infirmits
Here begynneth a litil boke the whiche traytied many gode thinges for the pestilence.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A17932 of text S108432 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 4592). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 20 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 9 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Here begynneth a treatyse agaynst pestele[n]ce [and] of ye infirmits
Here begynneth a litil boke the whiche traytied many gode thinges for the pestilence.
titleStmt.author: Joannes Jacobi, d. 1384. Régime de l'épidémie.
Knutsson, Bengt, d. 1462, attributed name.
Mikkelsen, Knud, attributed name.

notesStmt.note: Derived from a Latin translation by Bengt Knutsson of "Régime de l'épidémie" by Joannes Jacobi. The Latin version has been attributed to Knutsson and to Knud Mikkelsen. This English version was originally published ca. 1485 as: Here begynneth a litil boke the whiche traytied many gode thinges for the pestilence.
Printer's name from colophon; publication place from and publication date conjectured by STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Cambridge University Library.
